{{Infobox member of the Knesset | image= Yehuda Leib Maimon.jpg | birth_date = 11 December 1875 | birth_place = [[Mărculești]], [[Russian Empire]] | Year of Aliyah = 1913 | death_date = {{death date and age|1962|7|10|1875|12|11|df=y}} | death_place = | Knesset(s) = [[Israeli legislative election, 1949|1]] | party1 = [[United Religious Front]] | partyyears1 = 1949–1951 | minister1 = [[Ministry of Religious Services|Minister of Religions]] | ministeryears1 = 1948–1951 | minister2 = Minister of War Victims | ministeryears2 = 1948–1951 }}
'''Yehuda Leib Maimon''' ({{lang-he-n|יהודה לייב מימון}}{{ltr}}, 11 December 1875 – 10 July 1962, also known as '''Yehuda Leib HaCohen Maimon''') was an [[Israel]]i rabbi, politician and leader of the [[Religious Zionism|Religious Zionist]] movement. He was Israel's first [[Ministry of Religious Services|Minister of Religions]].<ref>[https://www.knesset.gov.il/mk/eng/mk_eng.asp?mk_individual_id_t=503 Yehuda Leib Maimon: Particulars] Knesset website</ref>
==Biography== Yehuda Leib Fishman (later Maimon) was born in [[Mărculești]], [[Bessarabia]] (then part of the [[Russian Empire]], now in [[Moldova]]), Maimon studied in a number of [[yeshivot]] and received rabbinic ordination from Rabbi [[Yechiel Michel Epstein]], the author of the [[Aruch HaShulchan]]. He was one of the founders of the [[Mizrachi (religious Zionism)|Mizrachi movement]] in 1902. By this time Maimon had moved to the [[Russian Empire]], where he was arrested several times for [[Zionism|Zionist]] activity. He was a delegate to the ninth [[Zionist Congress]] in 1909, and attended every one until Israeli independence in 1948.<ref name=PA/>
In 1913, Maimon [[aliyah|immigrated]] to [[Palestine (region)|Palestine]] (then part of the [[Ottoman Empire]]), but was expelled during [[World War I]]. He moved to the [[United States]], where he organised the Mizrachi movement.
His sister, [[Ada Maimon|Ada]] also served as a member of the Knesset for [[Mapai]]. One of his great grand-daughters is the model [[Nina Brosh]].
==Political career== After returning to [[Mandatory Palestine|Mandate Palestine]] (now under British control) in 1919, Maimon became leader of [[Mizrachi (political party)|Mizrachi]] in the country and together with [[Abraham Isaac Kook]] he helped establish the [[Chief Rabbinate of Israel|Chief Rabbinate]]. He was elected to the board of the [[Jewish Agency for Israel|Jewish Agency]] in 1935.<ref name=PA>[https://www.knesset.gov.il/mk/eng/mk_eng.asp?mk_individual_id_t=503 Yehuda Leib Maimon: Public Activities] Knesset website</ref> In 1937, he founded [[Mossad Harav Kook]],<ref>[http://www.mosadharavkook.com/store/about.php About] Mossad HaRav Kook</ref> a religious research foundation and notable publishing house named in honor of Rabbi [[Abraham Isaac Kook]].
In 1946, he was imprisoned by the British in [[Latrun]] during [[Operation Agatha]]. The British detained him on the Jewish Sabbath, and he objected to riding in a vehicle on the Sabbath, and offered instead to walk to a nearby police station. The British refused his offer and forced him into a waiting car.<ref>Hoffman, Bruce: ''Anonymous Soldiers'' (2015)</ref>
Maimon helped draft [[Declaration of Independence (Israel)|Israel's declaration of independence]], and was one of the people to sign it. He was appointed [[Ministry of Religious Services|Minister of Religions]], and also as Minister of War Victims in the [[Provisional government of Israel|provisional government]] set up immediately after independence. He was elected to the [[Israeli legislative election, 1949|first Knesset]] in 1949 as a member of the [[United Religious Front]] (an alliance of [[Agudat Yisrael]], [[Poalei Agudat Yisrael]], Mizrachi and [[Hapoel HaMizrachi]]) and retained his ministerial role in the [[First government of Israel|first]] and [[Second government of Israel|second governments]]. He was the driving force behind a [[Semikhah#Attempt by Rabbi Yehudah Leib Maimon.2C 1949|failed effort]] to reestablish the Sanhedrin. He lost his seat in the [[Israeli legislative election, 1951|1951 elections]].<ref>[https://www.knesset.gov.il/mk/eng/mk_eng.asp?mk_individual_id_t=503 Yehuda Leib Maimon: Knesset Activities] Knesset website</ref> ==Awards and recognition== In 1958, he was awarded the [[Israel Prize]] for his contribution to Rabbinical literature.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cms.education.gov.il/EducationCMS/Units/PrasIsrael/Tashyag/Tashkab_Tashyag_Rikuz.htm?DictionaryKey=Tashyah |title=Israel Prize recipients in 1958 (in Hebrew) |publisher=Israel Prize Official Site |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5mqejxurH |archivedate=January 17, 2010 |deadurl=unfit }}</ref>

{{short description|Dutch-American television personality, model, and interior designer}} {{Dutch name|van den Herik|Herik}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2016}} {{Infobox person | name = Yolanda Hadid | image = YolandaFosterHWOFMay2013.jpg | caption = Hadid in May 2013 | birth_name = Yolanda Johanna Jacoba van den Herik | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1964|01|11|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Papendrecht]], Netherlands | residence = [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S.{{cite web|last1=Halberg|first1=Morgan|title=All the Hadids Moved to New York; Justin Theroux Has a Neighbor Problem|url=http://observer.com/2017/05/yolanda-hadid-moves-to-new-york/|website=Observer|language=English|date=26 May 2017|accessdate=28 May 2017}} | nationality = Dutch, American | other_names = Yolanda Foster | occupation = Television personality, model | known_for = {{nowrap|''[[The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills]]''}} | net_worth = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Mohamed Hadid]]|1994|2000|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|[[David Foster]]|2011|2017|reason=divorced}} | children = [[Gigi Hadid]]
[[Bella Hadid]]
[[Anwar Hadid]] | website = [https://web.archive.org/web/20130625001515/https://www.yolanda.com/ Archived website] | alias = Yolanda Foster }} '''Yolanda Hadid''' ({{IPAc-en|h|ə|'|d|iː|d}}; [[Married and maiden names|née]] '''van den Herik'''; formerly '''Foster'''; born 11 January 1964){{cite web|title=About me – Yolanda|url=https://www.yolanda.com/about|publisher=Yolanda.com|accessdate=2 July 2013| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141218140443/http://www.yolanda.com/about | archivedate=18 December 2014}} is a [[Dutch-American]] television personality and former model. She is best known as a star of the American [[reality-television]] show ''[[The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills]]''. She is mother to models [[Gigi Hadid|Gigi]], [[Bella Hadid|Bella]], and [[Anwar Hadid]]. ==Early life== Yolanda van den Herik was born and raised in [[Papendrecht]], [[Netherlands]], to a family of Christian background. She has a brother named Leo.{{cite news|last1=Borgdorff|first1=Suzanne|title=Bloedmooie Gigi Hadid trots op Nederlandse roots / Gorgeous Gigi Hadid's proud Dutch roots|url=http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1002/Show/article/detail/4159771/2015/10/09/Bloedmooie-Gigi-Hadid-trots-op-Nederlandse-roots.dhtml|accessdate=1 January 2016|work=[[Algemeen Dagblad]] / General Newspaper | location = Rotterdam|date=9 October 2015| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151017005108/http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1002/Show/article/detail/4159771/2015/10/09/Bloedmooie-Gigi-Hadid-trots-op-Nederlandse-roots.dhtml | archivedate= 17 October 2015 | deadurl=no | quote= ...haar Nederlandse Hollywoodmoeder Yolanda Foster-van den Herik. / her Dutch Hollywood mother Yolanda Foster van den Herik.|language=dutch}} When she was seven years old, her father died in a car accident, leaving her mother to raise the two children. ==Career== Dutch designer [[Frans Molenaar]] asked van den Herik to replace one of his models at a show, where she was discovered by [[Eileen Ford]] and signed a contract with [[Ford Models]]. Afterward, van den Herik modeled in Paris, [[Milan]], [[Sydney]], [[Cape Town]], [[Tokyo]], New York, Los Angeles and [[Hamburg]]. She modeled for 15 years before wanting to settle down and start a family. In 1994, van den Herik moved to Los Angeles to start her family after meeting and marrying Mohamed Hadid.{{cite web|title=Yolanda H. Foster |url=http://www.bravotv.com/people/yolanda-h-foster/bio |publisher=[[Bravo (U.S. TV network)|Bravo]] |accessdate=2 July 2013 |archivedate=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6cVIVD5qA?url=http://www.bravotv.com/people/yolanda-h-foster |deadurl=no |df= |date=2012-09-13 }} Her memoir ''Believe Me: My Battle with the Invisible Disability of Lyme Disease'', was published in 2017.{{Cite web|title = Yolanda Hadid Pens Book About Her Battle With Lyme Disease |url = http://www.etonline.com/news/190576_yolanda_hadid_pens_book_about_her_battle_with_lyme_disease/|publisher = [[Entertainment Tonight]] | first= Jackie |last=Willis |date=June 8, 2016|access-date = June 20, 2016}} On January 11, 2018, her reality TV-show competition ''Making a Model with Yolanda Hadid'' premiered on [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]], which had been developed under the working title ''Model Moms.''{{cite press release|url=http://thefutoncritic.com/news/2017/11/30/new-competition-reality-series-making-a-model-with-yolanda-hadid-premieres-january-11-438312/20171130lifetime01/| title=New Competition Reality Series "Making a Model with Yolanda Hadid" Premieres January 11|publisher=[[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]]|via=TheFutonCritic.com|date= November 30, 2017|accessdate=January 17, 2018|archivedate=January 17, 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/9nUcN| deadurl=no}} ==Personal life== Van den Herik's first marriage was to [[Mohamed Hadid]], a real estate developer, from 1994 until 2000.{{cite news|last1=Corriston|first1=Michele|title=Yolanda Drops 'Foster' as Divorce Proceeds, Takes Ex-Husband's Name Again|url=http://www.people.com/article/why-yolanda-foster-goes-by-hadid-now|accessdate=18 February 2016|work=People|date=17 February 2016| archivedate= 18 February 2016| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160218093942/http://www.people.com/article/why-yolanda-foster-goes-by-hadid-now}} The couple have three children together, [[Gigi Hadid|Jelena "Gigi"]] (born 23 April 1995), [[Bella Hadid|Isabella "Bella"]] (born 9 October 1996), and [[Anwar Hadid|Anwar]] (born 22 June 1999). Van den Herik married musician, composer and producer [[David Foster]] in [[Beverly Hills, California]] on 11 November 2011, after becoming engaged on Christmas Eve, 2010.{{cite news|authorlink=Robin Leach |last=Leach |first=Robin |url=http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2011/nov/16/david-foster-weds-model-yolanda-hadid-fourth-walk-/ |title=David Foster weds model Yolanda Hadid in fourth walk down the aisle |work=[[Las Vegas Sun]] |location=Las Vegas, Nevada |date=16 November 2011 |accessdate=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6cVJEXj3W?url=http://lasvegassun.com/vegasdeluxe/2011/nov/16/david-foster-weds-model-yolanda-hadid-fourth-walk-/ |archivedate=23 October 2015 |deadurl=no |df= }} In 2012, Van den Herik was diagnosed with [[Lyme disease]], as she has stated multiple times on several episodes of ''The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills''. In December 2012, she reported that she was having a port implanted in her arm to help treat her chronic Lyme disease. In April 2013, she had the port removed.{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Zach|title=Yolanda Foster Recovering From Surgery Related to Lyme Disease|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/yolanda-foster-recovering-from-surgery-related-to-lyme-disease-2013224|work=[[Us Weekly]]|accessdate= 2 July 2013|date=22 April 2013| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150910084059/http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/yolanda-foster-recovering-from-surgery-related-to-lyme-disease-2013224 | archivedate= 10 September 2015| deadurl=no}} In January 2015, she revealed that, as a consequence of the illness, she had "lost the ability to read, write, or even watch TV".{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/article/yolanda-foster-lyme-disease-blog-real-housewives-beverly-hills|title=Real Housewives's Yolanda Foster: I've Lost the Ability to Read and Write|date=19 January 2015 | first=Lynette| last=Rice|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|accessdate=8 February 2015| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20150906110702/http://www.people.com/article/yolanda-foster-lyme-disease-blog-real-housewives-beverly-hills | archivedate= 6 September 2015 | deadurl=no}} On 1 December 2015, Van den Herik announced she and David Foster planned to divorce.{{cite news|last1=McNeil|first1=Liz|title=Yolanda Foster and David Foster Divorcing|url=http://www.people.com/article/yolanda-foster-david-foster-divorcing|accessdate=1 December 2015|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|agency=[[Time Inc.]]|date=1 December 2015|location=United States}} The divorce was finalized on May 2017.{{cite web|url=http://radaronline.com/celebrity-news/yolanda-hadid-david-foster-divorce-finalized/|title=It's Official! Yolanda Hadid & David Foster Divorce Finalized|author=Radar Staff|work=Radar Online|date=24 May 2017|accessdate=28 May 2017}} == Filmography == {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Title !Role ! class="unsortable" |Notes |- |1991 |''[[1st & Ten (1984 TV series)|1st & Ten]]'' |Betty Ann |"Flashbacks" (Season 7, Episode 15) |- |2011–2012 |''Nederlandse Hollywood Vrouwen'' |Herself |Series regular |- |2012–2016 |''[[The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills]]'' |Herself |Series regular |- |2013 |''[[Vanderpump Rules]]'' |Herself |"Tooth or Consequences" (Season 2, Episode 1) |- |2014 |[[The Real Housewives of New York City|''The Real Housewives of New York City'']] |Herself |"Unhappy Anniversary" (Season 6, Episode 6) |- |2017 |[[Project Runway|''Project Runway'']] |Herself / Guest Judge |3 episodes |- |2018 |''Making a Model with Yolanda Hadid'' |Herself / Host |8 episodes |} === Music videos === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Title !Artist !
